content:
I'm so sorry to hear that your grandmother passed away before you could learn more about the painting's history. But it's wonderful that you're taking the initiative to preserve and restore it, and I'm sure it will be a beautiful tribute to her memory.

I'm excited to hear that you've taken it to a local art conservation studio, and I'm sure they'll do a wonderful job restoring it. Six weeks might seem like a long time, but it's worth the wait to see the painting in all its glory. I'm sure you'll be thrilled when it's finally back in your possession.

And wow, your art book collection sounds amazing! Thrift stores and garage sales can be treasure troves for art books, and it's great that you're curating a dedicated section in your home library. Art history and theory books can be so inspiring, and I'm sure they'll provide endless hours of fascinating reading.

What kind of books have you been finding? Are you focusing on specific periods, styles, or artists, or is your collection more eclectic? Do you have any rare or unusual finds that you're particularly proud of?

Also, have you considered displaying any of your art books with the covers facing outwards, or using book stands or easels to showcase particularly beautiful or inspiring volumes?
